description: Three police officers were fatally shot and two wounded Wednesday in southern Pennsylvania, and the shooter was killed by police, authorities said.
title: 3 police officers killed, 2 injured in Pennsylvania shooting, police say

description: Walt Disney-owned ABC said on Wednesday it will indefinitely stop airing Jimmy Kimmel Live! after remarks the late-night host made about Charlie Kirk's assassination came under harsh criticism from the head of the U.S. Federal Communications Commission.
title: ABC to indefinitely halt Jimmy Kimmel Live! broadcasts, citing comments made after Charlie Kirk killing

description: The Alberta Law Enforcement Response Teams dismantled a cross-border drug operation and seized its largest amount of cocaine ever, as well as 15 firearms, nearly one million dollars in cash and seven vehicles retrofitted with hidden compartments.
title: Bust of cocaine ring tied to Mexican cartels results in one of Alberta's largest ever drug seizures

description: A furry, whiskered stowaway has survived an unlikely trip across the Atlantic and is now safe in a Nova Scotia home.
title: Stowaway Italian kitten finds forever home in N.S. after transatlantic voyage

description: Mike Waltz almost certainly will not make his debut as U.S. President Donald Trump's U.S. ambassador to the United Nations during a gathering of world leaders next week after delays and procedural hurdles postponed his confirmation.
title: Mike Waltz still waiting for confirmation, months after Trump nominated him as UN envoy

description: The Liberal government is introducing new legislation on Friday to make it a crime to intentionally promote hatred against identifiable groups in public using certain hate- or terrorism-related symbols like swastikas, CBC News has learned.
title: Government to table bill Friday criminalizing use of certain symbols to promote hate

description: The family of a 30-year-old man whose death in an RCMP holding cell went undiscovered for hours are calling for an independent review after the arresting officers were cleared of wrongdoing.
title: Officers cleared after Alberta man found dead in RCMP holding cell hours after he collapsed

description: Mayor Suzanne Kukko says residents of Nipigon in northern Ontario are on edge after a bear entered a couple's home on Tuesday and attacked them. The couple managed to escape to a bedroom, with their dog barricading the bear until police arrived.
title: Couple injured in bear attack after it entered their home in Nipigon, Ont.

description: Did it feel like an unusually hot summer? This year, thanks to climate change, Canadians experienced a lot more days hot enough to put their health at risk. A new analysis counts exactly how many.
title: Here's how many 'risky heat' days climate change added to our summer this year

description: Born in Wolfville, N.S., in 1938, Oliver made history in 1990 by becoming the first Black man to be appointed to the Senate of Canada.
title: Donald Oliver, pioneering senator and influential Black Nova Scotian, dead at 86

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney paid tribute to Ken Dryden in the House of Commons on Wednesday. Dryden, a six-time Stanley Cup-winning goalie with the Montreal Canadiens, author and former Liberal MP for the Toronto riding of York Centre, died on Sept. 5.
title: Carney honours Ken Dryden, 'a national hero and a personal idol'

description: Cardi B is pregnant with her fourth child, she announced on Wednesday. It will be her first with boyfriend Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots' wide receiver.
title: Cardi B is pregnant with her 4th child. It will be her 1st with Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs

description: While observers weren't necessarily expecting a bow or curtsy, they may not have predicted a greeting this informal, either.
title: Trump called Catherine 'beautiful' — but was it a breach of royal protocol, or just cringey?

description: Connor McDavid's unresolved contract situation hangs over the Edmonton Oilers as training camp opens.
title: Edmonton Oilers GM Stan Bowman still waiting on Connor McDavid contract

description: The TV series has become a cross-generational hit, garnering millions of streams and spawning real-life watch parties. And while the series has ended, the author of the books the show is based on teased there may be more of the story still to come.
title: The sun sets on The Summer I Turned Pretty as series finale leaves fans (mostly) satisfied

description: Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree says his government is not ready to announce when and for how long its gun amnesty program will be extended.
title: With end to firearm amnesty weeks away, minister says he's not ready to detail extension

description: The former director who led the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention for just 29 days this summer, and a high-placed deputy, each said Thursday they are concerned preventable diseases for children will needlessly return under what they characterized as Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s politicization of health science.
title: Former CDC officials say Kennedy Jr. has made children less safe, politicized health

description: Toronto-based lawyer Hana Marku, who represents around 50 Palestinians, said each one was blocked without explanation from submitting applications under the temporary visa program the Canadian government created to help them flee the Israel-Hamas war.
title: Toronto lawyer says Canada blocked visa applications without explanation for Gazans fleeing war

description: In St. Catharines, Ont., court Wednesday, Daniel Senecal, accused in the sexual assault of a three-year-old Welland girl, was charged with breach of probation to go with five previous counts. The 25-year-old appeared briefly via video from the Toronto South Detention Centre.
title: Registered sex offender charged with 6th count in Welland, Ont., case involving attack on toddler

description: Based on Thomas Pynchon's novel Vineland, director Paul Thomas Anderson's One Battle After Another is as sobering as it is impressive.
title: One Battle After Another is terrifying. That's why it's great

description: A total of 23 bullets struck the Regina home where an 11-year-old girl was injured last month, in what police now say was a targeted attack. In an interview with CBC News on Wednesday, the girl's father said just one bullet entered his daughter's bedroom, and she was struck in the side of her body.
title: 23 bullets hit Regina home where 11-year-old girl injured, father says

description: CBC News confirmed with two party sources that red flags were raised with regards to more than 2,000 new party members, each of whom were connected to the same email domain and fake phone numbers.
title: Allegations of fake sign-ups, ballot stuffing cloud B.C. Conservative leadership review

description: Police say the alleged offences occurred at the Nova Scotia Youth Centre in Waterville, N.S., between 1989 and 2015.
title: Ex-swim instructor at N.S. youth correctional facility facing 66 sex-related charges

description: Ben & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield is leaving the ice cream brand after 47 years, saying the independence it once had to speak up on social issues has been stifled by parent company Unilever.
title: Ben & Jerry's co-founder resigns, with criticism of parent co. Unilever, Trump administration

description: NORAD scrambled over Calgary on Monday in response to bomb threats aboard 3 incoming flights from Germany
title: 3 flights landing in Calgary this week were targeted with bomb threats. Here's how they're handled

description: The Israeli military said on Wednesday it was opening an additional route for 48 hours that Palestinians could use to leave Gaza City as it stepped up efforts to empty the city of civilians and confront thousands of Hamas combatants.
title: Israel opens new temporary route out of Gaza City as tanks advance, more forced to flee

description: Yulia Navalnaya, the wife of late Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny, said that foreign laboratory tests on biological samples obtained from her husband showed that he was poisoned.
title: Yulia Navalnaya says lab tests show Alexei Navalny was poisoned in prison

description: Hundreds of temporary foreign workers in P.E.I.’s seafood processing sector have seen their hours cut or faced layoffs this year after China imposed tariffs on Canadian seafood, according to the Cooper Institute.
title: P.E.I.'s migrant workers grappling with fewer hours or layoffs due to Chinese seafood tariffs

description: An Ontario woman says she's still distressed over a year after finding her 64-year-old brother dead in his bed, later learning that a nurse providing him with home care failed to follow protocol.
title: Sister of Ontario man found dead in bed says apology not enough after home-care nurse didn't follow protocol

description: After losing her home to a massive wildfire, Vanessa Butler just wanted to find one physical connection to her grandfather in the ash and rubble.
title: A wildfire destroyed her home, but she recovered the last remaining connection to her grandfather

description: A London, Ont., business owner says Google is hurting her bottom line by refusing to fully refund charges that stem from a hacking attack at a third-party business she worked with to create online ads.
title: After fraudsters hacked her ad account, Ontario business owner says she had to fight Google

description: Reports of delusions fuelled by conversations with AI chatbots have been growing, with some cases involving psychotic breaks, hospital stays and even violence. Two Canadians have launched an online support group to help people through their experiences.
title: AI-fuelled delusions are hurting Canadians. Here are some of their stories

description: Brian Hartman was in his hometown of Hamilton for the recent three-day Supercrawl arts and music festival, where dozens of people got to go up against the international chess master. It's something attendees and organizers hope will happen again next year.
title: Dozens test their skills against international chess master Brian Hartman in his hometown of Hamilton

description: Kathryn McRuer-Nicol was studying how Quebec salt marshes might hold answers to understanding and coping with the impacts of climate change. When she and her team started experiencing extreme heat and had to halt their work, it made her rethink her approach to science.
title: I study climate change. This summer, it got too hot for me to do my field work

description: It's another year of kids' books, reading and fun! The annual 'Canada Reads for kids' event known as CBC Kids Reads returns for its third season.
title: Jay Baruchel, Anna Lambe, Andrew Phung and more take part in CBC Kids' annual literature celebration

description: Utah prosecutors said Tuesday they would seek the death penalty for the man accused of killing conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Utah is only one of 27 states where that can still happen.
title: Trump wanted the death penalty for Charlie Kirk's alleged killer. Now, it's on the table
